channel.title: Comments on: Windows Server 2008 – How To Enable Telnet
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Andy
item.dc:creator: Andy
item.description: Wow, this is so stupid. I'm sitting here 15 minutes waiting for telnet to install. Talking about going backwards Microsoft.
item.content:encoded: Wow, this is so stupid. I’m sitting here 15 minutes waiting for telnet to install. Talking about going backwards Microsoft.

item.title: By: Rob Earl
item.dc:creator: Rob Earl
item.description: Hopefully it goes without saying but telnet should really only be used internally. Anyone wanting to do remote administration over the internet should be looking for more secure alternatives such as ssh.
item.content:encoded: Hopefully it goes without saying but telnet should really only be used internally. Anyone wanting to do remote administration over the internet should be looking for more secure alternatives such as ssh.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
On windows 7, you can go to Control Panel–>programs–>Turn Windows features on or off

Then check Telnet client from the list
